message.body: I learned today that my mom didn't have a will, so everything defaults to my dad.
My dad is irresponsible and I can't trust him with anything, so I haven't told him yet.
I need to have him sign a form to renounce his rights over my mom's accounts/belongings so I can take control of everything.
I also think he's lying to me about money. According to the funeral director, the only person he received money from is me, and the receipts reflect that.
Oh gosh.
But my dad says he's put money in, and as far as I can tell, that's a lie.
So...I can't touch anything that my mother did not explicitly designate me add the beneficiary to.
So the only thing I did today was report my mother's death to the SSA.
I also don't know what I'm going to do about my job.
I have things to take care of here, and some things are Monday to Friday only.
So I might need to start working weekends.
And I still don't know what to do about old clothes and furniture.
Or life.
I'm sorry, that seems like a hard situation. I don't know John. I would definitely talk to a financial advisor. I have an uncle who does such things, I c
ould call if you want. Now about work...
You really needed at least a week to at least start a lot of these things...
I wod call your employer back and explain the whole thing to them, that you're the only one able to do all this stuff and you have to be here...
They can't fire you, it's not like you're faking.
I'm just sorry you have to go through all this stuff.
Ask to extend your bereavement
You need time to heal and yet you've got to put up with all this crap.
This is kid of like what happened when Taylor (my brother's boyfriend) passed...
